name: Semaphore in a nutshell
description: A brief introduction to the Semaphore protocol with an overview of the main concepts (Merkle trees and nullifiers), differences from alternatives and tutorials on how to use libraries and contracts. Attendees will be more aware of the limitations and potential of the protocol, and will know how best to use the tools provided to build zero knowledge DApps. The workshop will start with a short presentation and will continue engaging in practical coding, specifically focusing on libraries and contracts.

speakers.name: Cedoor
speakers.bio: I have worked as a full-stack developer and software engineer and in recent years focusing on blockchain and zero knowledge technologies. Supporter of free software and privacy. My main goal is to make these technologies more accessible and dev-friendly.
